definition: Sharif (name)/Nawaz Sharif (1949-), Pakistani politician
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: Still, the list of those caught pleases Mr Sherif.
sentences.chinese: 不过，已被捕获的人员名单还是能另谢里夫满意的。

sentences.english: Yet Sharif and its ilk continue to thrive.
sentences.chinese: 然而谢里夫及其同类大学继续茁壮成长。

sentences.english: El-Sherif had already been remanded into custody for 15 days for the corruption probe.
sentences.chinese: 谢里夫已被要求拘留15天以备腐败调查。

sentences.english: The letter of response is also an indication of the arrogance of the Aberdeen Sheriff.
sentences.chinese: 信的反应，也是对香港仔谢里夫傲慢的迹象。

sentences.english: 'We have to allow for the law to take its course, ' said Ahsan Iqbal, a spokesman for Mr.
sentences.chinese: “我们必须依法办事，”谢里夫所在党派发言人说。

sentences.english: I do want someone else like PML-N.
sentences.chinese: 但我非常支持像谢里夫派这样的其它党派。

sentences.english: Sharif said he wanted to come anyway.
sentences.chinese: 谢里夫说，无论怎样他都会来访。

definition: Ahmed (name)
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Abdullah (name)
Nasr or Nasser (Arab name)/Gamal Abdel Nasser (1918-1970), Egyptian President
Mahmoud Ahmadinejad (1956-), Iranian fundamentalist politician, president of Iran 2005-2013/abbr. for 艾哈邁迪內賈德|艾哈迈迪内贾德
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
King Fahd of Saudi Arabia
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Medvedyev (name)/Dmitry Anatolyevich Medvedev (1965-), Russian lawyer and politician, president of Russian Federation from 2008
Massoud (name)/Ahmed Shah Massoud (1953-2001), Tajik Afghan engineer, military man and anti-Taleban leader
Sadiq or Sadik (name)
Muhammad Naguib (1901-1984), first president of the Republic of Egypt
Hosni Mubarak (1928-), former Egyptian President and military commander
Pervez Musharraf (1943-), Pakistani general and politician, president 2001-2008
Chavez, Spanish name
